body_html: @girving my thought was to add some tensor version metadata similar to variable versioning used in SSA. This would mean that some internal tensor version bookkeeping would have to be performed whenever __setitem__ is invoked, and that a tensor version would have to be recorded whenever a tensor is passed to an op since a single tensor python reference could refer to different versions depending on when it's used. Not sure if that makes sense, but as I think about it more it's probably more complicated than is worthwhile anyway.

body: @girving my thought was to add some tensor version metadata similar to variable versioning used in SSA. This would mean that some internal tensor version bookkeeping would have to be performed whenever `__setitem__` is invoked, and that a tensor version would have to be recorded whenever a tensor is passed to an op since a single tensor python reference could refer to different versions depending on when it's used. Not sure if that makes sense, but as I think about it more it's probably more complicated than is worthwhile anyway.
